name: gfc_2020_v18_gainlossyear
title: Year of forest cover gain event
description: Forest gain during the period 2000-2012, defined as the inverse of loss, or a non-forest to forest change entirely within the study period. Encoded as either 1 (gain) or 0 (no gain).
details: Output format is a column for every year, where rows in column are the number of pixels of forest gain associated with that year and unit of analysis. Forest gain is only associated with the first year it is detected and no subsequent years.

extract_types_info.categorical: number of pixels of forest loss which occured in each year
extract_types_info.count: total count of pixels per unit of analysis

extras.citation: Hansen, M. C., P. V. Potapov, R. Moore, M. Hancher, S. A. Turubanova, A. Tyukavina, D. Thau, S. V. Stehman, S. J. Goetz, T. R. Loveland, A. Kommareddy, A. Egorov, L. Chini, C. O. Justice, and J. R. G. Townshend. 2013. “High-Resolution Global Maps of 21st-Century Forest Cover Change.” Science 342 (15 November): 850–53.
